phonetic: 10.73 Fakadhabūhu Fanajjaynāhu Wa Man Ma`ahu Fī Al-Fulki Wa Ja`alnāhum Khalā'ifa Wa 'Aghraqnā Al-Ladhīna Kadhabū Bi'āyātinā Fānžur Kayfa Kāna `Āqibatu Al-Mundharīna

translations.english_saheeh: And they denied him, so We saved him and those with him in the ship and made them successors, and We drowned those who denied Our signs. Then see how was the end of those who were warned.
translations.english_hilali_khan: They denied him, but We delivered him, and those with him in the ship, and We made them generations replacing one after another, while We drowned those who belied Our Ayât (proofs, evidence, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.). Then see what was the end of those who were warned.
translations.english_rwwad: But they rejected him, so We saved him and those who were with him in the Ark, and made them successors; and We drowned those who rejected Our signs. Then see how was the end of those who were warned.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ بَعَثۡنَا مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِۦ رُسُلًا إِلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِمۡ فَجَآءُوهُم بِٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتِ فَمَا كَانُواْ لِيُؤۡمِنُواْ بِمَا كَذَّبُواْ بِهِۦ مِن قَبۡلُۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَطۡبَعُ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِ ٱلۡمُعۡتَدِينَ
phonetic: 10.74 Thumma Ba`athnā Min Ba`dihi Rusulāan 'Ilá Qawmihim Fajā'ūhum Bil-Bayyināti Famā Kānū Liyu'uminū Bimā Kadhabū Bihi Min Qablu Kadhālika Naţba`u `Alá Qulūbi Al-Mu`tadīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [536]- i.e., the succeeding generations were persistent in disbelief.

translations.english_saheeh: Then We sent after him messengers to their peoples, and they came to them with clear proofs. But they were not to believe in that which they had denied before.[536] Thus We seal over the hearts of the transgressors.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then after him We sent Messengers to their people. They brought them clear proofs, but they would not believe what they had already rejected beforehand. Thus We seal the hearts of the transgressors (those who disbelieve in the Oneness of Allâh and disobey Him).
translations.english_rwwad: Then We sent after him messengers to their [own] peoples; they came to them with clear proofs, but they would not believe in what they had already rejected beforehand. This is how We seal the hearts of the transgressors.

arabic_text: ثُمَّ بَعَثۡنَا مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِم مُّوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَمَلَإِيْهِۦ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا فَٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ وَكَانُواْ قَوۡمٗا مُّجۡرِمِينَ
phonetic: 10.75 Thumma Ba`athnā Min Ba`dihim Mūsá Wa Hārūna 'Ilá Fir`awna Wa Mala'ihi Bi'āyātinā Fāstakbarū Wa Kānū Qawmāan Mujrimīna

translations.english_saheeh: Then We sent after them Moses and Aaron to Pharaoh and his establishment with Our signs, but they behaved arrogantly and were a criminal people.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then after them We sent Mûsâ (Moses) and Hârûn (Aaron) to Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs with Our Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.). But they behaved arrogantly and were Mujrimûn (disbelievers, sinners, polytheists, criminals) folk.
translations.english_rwwad: Then We sent after them Moses and Aaron with Our signs to Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they showed arrogance and were wicked people.

arabic_text: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمُ ٱلۡحَقُّ مِنۡ عِندِنَا قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسِحۡرٞ مُّبِينٞ
phonetic: 10.76 Falammā Jā'ahumu Al-Ĥaqqu Min `Indinā Qālū 'Inna Hādhā Lasiĥrun Mubīnun

translations.english_saheeh: So when there came to them the truth from Us, they said, "Indeed, this is obvious magic."
translations.english_hilali_khan: So when came to them the truth from Us, they said: "This is indeed clear magic."
translations.english_rwwad: So when the truth came to them from Us, they said, “This is indeed a clear magic!”

arabic_text: قَالَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَتَقُولُونَ لِلۡحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَكُمۡۖ أَسِحۡرٌ هَٰذَا وَلَا يُفۡلِحُ ٱلسَّٰحِرُونَ
phonetic: 10.77 Qāla Mūsá 'Ataqūlūna Lilĥaqqi Lammā Jā'akum 'Asiĥrun Hādhā Wa Lā Yufliĥu As-Sāĥirūna

translations.english_saheeh: Moses said, "Do you say [thus] about the truth when it has come to you? Is this magic? But magicians will not succeed."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Mûsâ (Moses) said: "Say you (this) about the truth when it has come to you? Is this magic? But the magicians will never be successful."
translations.english_rwwad: Moses said, “Do you say this about the truth after it has come to you? Can this be magic? But magicians will never succeed.”

arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ أَجِئۡتَنَا لِتَلۡفِتَنَا عَمَّا وَجَدۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ ءَابَآءَنَا وَتَكُونَ لَكُمَا ٱلۡكِبۡرِيَآءُ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا نَحۡنُ لَكُمَا بِمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 10.78 Qālū 'Aji'tanā Litalfitanā `Ammā Wajadnā `Alayhi 'Ābā'anā Wa Takūna Lakumā Al-Kibriyā'u Fī Al-'Arđi Wa Mā Naĥnu Lakumā Bimu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: They said, "Have you come to us to turn us away from that upon which we found our fathers and so that you two may have grandeur in the land? And we are not believers in you."
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "Have you come to us to turn us away from that (Faith) we found our fathers following, and that you two may have greatness in the land? We are not going to believe you two!"
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “Have you come to turn us away from what we found our forefathers following, so that you two might become supreme in the land? We will never believe in you!”

arabic_text: وَقَالَ فِرۡعَوۡنُ ٱئۡتُونِي بِكُلِّ سَٰحِرٍ عَلِيمٖ
phonetic: 10.79 Wa Qāla Fir`awnu A'tūnī Bikulli Sāĥirin `Alīmin

translations.english_saheeh: And Pharaoh said, "Bring to me every learned magician."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) said: "Bring me every well-versed sorcerer."
translations.english_rwwad: Pharaoh said, “Bring me all learned magicians.”

arabic_text: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلۡقُواْ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلۡقُونَ
phonetic: 10.80 Falammā Jā'a As-Saĥaratu Qāla Lahum Mūsá 'Alqū Mā 'Antum Mulqūna

translations.english_saheeh: So when the magicians came, Moses said to them, "Throw down whatever you will throw."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And when the sorcerers came, Mûsâ (Moses) said to them: "Cast down what you want to cast!"
translations.english_rwwad: When the magicians came, Moses said to them, “Cast whatever you have to cast.”

arabic_text: فَلَمَّآ أَلۡقَوۡاْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ مَا جِئۡتُم بِهِ ٱلسِّحۡرُۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَيُبۡطِلُهُۥٓ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُصۡلِحُ عَمَلَ ٱلۡمُفۡسِدِينَ
phonetic: 10.81 Falammā 'Alqaw Qāla Mūsá Mā Ji'tum Bihi As-Siĥru 'Inna Allāha Sayubţiluhu 'Inna Allāha Lā Yuşliĥu `Amala Al-Mufsidīna

translations.english_saheeh: And when they had thrown, Moses said, "What you have brought is [only] magic. Indeed, Allāh will expose its worthlessness. Indeed, Allāh does not amend the work of corrupters.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then when they had cast down, Mûsâ (Moses) said: "What you have brought is sorcery; Allâh will surely make it of no effect. Verily, Allâh does not set right the work of Al-Mufsidûn (the evil-doers, corrupters).
translations.english_rwwad: When they did, Moses said, “All what you have brought is mere magic; Allah will surely make it useless, for Allah does not let the work of the mischief-makers to thrive.

arabic_text: وَيُحِقُّ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡحَقَّ بِكَلِمَٰتِهِۦ وَلَوۡ كَرِهَ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ
phonetic: 10.82 Wa Yuĥiqqu Allāhu Al-Ĥaqqa Bikalimātihi Wa Law Kariha Al-Mujrimūna

translations.english_saheeh: And Allāh will establish the truth by His words, even if the criminals dislike it."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And Allâh will establish and make apparent the truth by His Words, however much the Mujrimûn (criminals, disbelievers, polytheists, sinners) may hate it."
translations.english_rwwad: And Allah establishes the truth by His Words, even though the wicked abhor it.”

arabic_text: فَمَآ ءَامَنَ لِمُوسَىٰٓ إِلَّا ذُرِّيَّةٞ مِّن قَوۡمِهِۦ عَلَىٰ خَوۡفٖ مِّن فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَمَلَإِيْهِمۡ أَن يَفۡتِنَهُمۡۚ وَإِنَّ فِرۡعَوۡنَ لَعَالٖ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَإِنَّهُۥ لَمِنَ ٱلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ
phonetic: 10.83 Famā 'Āmana Limūsá 'Illā Dhurrīyatun Min Qawmihi `Alá Khawfin Min Fir`awna Wa Mala'ihim 'An Yaftinahum Wa 'Inna Fir`awna La`ālin Fī Al-'Arđi Wa 'Innahu Lamina Al-Musrifīna

translations.english_saheeh: But no one believed Moses, except [some] offspring [i.e., youths] among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and his establishment that they would persecute them. And indeed, Pharaoh was haughty within the land, and indeed, he was of the transgressors.
translations.english_hilali_khan: But none believed in Mûsâ (Moses) except the offspring of his people, because of the fear of Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs, lest they should persecute them; and verily, Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) was an arrogant tyrant on the earth, he was indeed one of the Musrifûn (polytheists, sinners and transgressors, those who give up the truth and follow the evil, and commit all kinds of great sins).
translations.english_rwwad: But none believed in Moses except few youth of his own people, despite their fear that Pharaoh and their own chiefs might persecute them. Pharaoh was indeed a tyrant in the land and he was truly one of the transgressors.

arabic_text: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ يَٰقَوۡمِ إِن كُنتُمۡ ءَامَنتُم بِٱللَّهِ فَعَلَيۡهِ تَوَكَّلُوٓاْ إِن كُنتُم مُّسۡلِمِينَ
phonetic: 10.84 Wa Qāla Mūsá Yā Qawmi 'In Kuntum 'Āmantum Billāhi Fa`alayhi Tawakkalū 'In Kuntum Muslimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And Moses said, "O my people, if you have believed in Allāh, then rely upon Him, if you should be Muslims [i.e., submitting to Him]."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Mûsâ (Moses) said: "O my people! If you have believed in Allâh, then put your trust in Him if you are Muslims (those who submit to Allâh’s Will)."
translations.english_rwwad: Moses said, “O my people, if you have faith in Allah, then put your trust in Him, if you have truly submitted.”

arabic_text: فَقَالُواْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ تَوَكَّلۡنَا رَبَّنَا لَا تَجۡعَلۡنَا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 10.85 Faqālū `Alá Allāhi Tawakkalnā Rabbanā Lā Taj`alnā Fitnatan Lilqawmi Až-Žālimīna

translations.english_saheeh: So they said, "Upon Allāh do we rely. Our Lord, make us not [objects of] trial for the wrongdoing people
translations.english_hilali_khan: They said: "In Allâh we put our trust. Our Lord! Make us not a trial for the folk who are Zâlimûn (polytheists and wrong-doers) (i.e. do not make them overpower us).
translations.english_rwwad: They said, “In Allah we put our trust. Our Lord, do not subject us to the persecution of the oppressive people,

arabic_text: وَنَجِّنَا بِرَحۡمَتِكَ مِنَ ٱلۡقَوۡمِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
phonetic: 10.86 Wa Najjinā Biraĥmatika Mina Al-Qawmi Al-Kāfirīna

translations.english_saheeh: And save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people."
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And save us by Your Mercy from the disbelieving folk."
translations.english_rwwad: and save us by Your mercy from the disbelieving people.”

arabic_text: وَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَأَخِيهِ أَن تَبَوَّءَا لِقَوۡمِكُمَا بِمِصۡرَ بُيُوتٗا وَٱجۡعَلُواْ بُيُوتَكُمۡ قِبۡلَةٗ وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَۗ وَبَشِّرِ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 10.87 Wa 'Awĥaynā 'Ilá Mūsá Wa 'Akhīhi 'An Tabawwa'ā Liqawmikumā Bimişra Buyūtāan Wa Aj`alū Buyūtakum Qiblatan Wa 'Aqīmū Aş-Şalāata Wa Bashiri Al-Mu'uminīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [537]- In order that they might pray therein unseen by their enemy.

translations.english_saheeh: And We inspired to Moses and his brother, "Settle your people in Egypt in houses and make your houses [facing the] qiblah[537] and establish prayer and give good tidings to the believers."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We revealed to Mûsâ (Moses) and his brother (saying): "Provide dwellings for your people in Egypt, and make your dwellings as places for your worship, and perform As-Salât (Iqâmat-as-Salât ), and give glad tidings to the believers."
translations.english_rwwad: We inspired Moses and his brother, “Provide houses for your people in Egypt, and make your houses face the qiblah direction, establish prayer, and give glad tidings to the believers.”

arabic_text: وَقَالَ مُوسَىٰ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ ءَاتَيۡتَ فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَمَلَأَهُۥ زِينَةٗ وَأَمۡوَٰلٗا فِي ٱلۡحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنۡيَا رَبَّنَا لِيُضِلُّواْ عَن سَبِيلِكَۖ رَبَّنَا ٱطۡمِسۡ عَلَىٰٓ أَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ وَٱشۡدُدۡ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِمۡ فَلَا يُؤۡمِنُواْ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
phonetic: 10.88 Wa Qāla Mūsá Rabbanā 'Innaka 'Ātayta Fir`awna Wa Mala'ahu Zīnatan Wa 'Amwālāan Fī Al-Ĥayāati Ad-Dunyā Rabbanā Liyuđillū `An Sabīlika Rabbanā Aţmis `Alá 'Amwālihim Wa Ashdud `Alá Qulūbihim Falā Yu'uminū Ĥattá Yaraw Al-`Adhāba Al-'Alīma

translations.english_saheeh: And Moses said, "Our Lord, indeed You have given Pharaoh and his establishment splendor and wealth in the worldly life, our Lord, that they may lead [men] astray from Your way. Our Lord, obliterate their wealth and harden their hearts so that they will not believe until they see the painful punishment."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And Mûsâ (Moses) said: "Our Lord! You have indeed bestowed on Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) and his chiefs splendour and wealth in the life of this world, our Lord! that they may lead men astray from Your Path. Our Lord! Destroy their wealth, and harden their hearts, so that they will not believe until they see the painful torment."
translations.english_rwwad: Moses said, “Our Lord, You have given Pharaoh and his chiefs splendor and wealth in the life of this world. Our Lord, they may lead people astray from Your way. Our Lord, destroy their wealth and harden their hearts, so that they will not believe until they see the painful punishment.”

arabic_text: قَالَ قَدۡ أُجِيبَت دَّعۡوَتُكُمَا فَٱسۡتَقِيمَا وَلَا تَتَّبِعَآنِّ سَبِيلَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
phonetic: 10.89 Qāla Qad 'Ujībat Da`watukumā Fāstaqīmā Wa Lā Tattabi`āni Sabīla Al-Ladhīna Lā Ya`lamūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [538]- Literally, "the supplication of both of you," i.e., that of Moses and of Aaron, who joined by saying, "Āmeen" ("O Allāh, respond").

translations.english_saheeh: [Allāh] said, "Your supplication has been answered."[538] So remain on a right course and follow not the way of those who do not know."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Allâh said: "Verily, the invocation of you both is accepted. So you both keep to the Straight Way (i.e. keep on doing good deeds and preaching Allâh’s Message with patience), and follow not the path of those who know not (the truth i.e. to believe in the Oneness of Allâh, and also to believe in the Reward of Allâh: Paradise)."
translations.english_rwwad: Allah said [to Moses and Aaron], “Your prayer is answered, so be steadfast on the straight path, and do not follow the way of those who do not know.”

arabic_text: ۞ وَجَٰوَزۡنَا بِبَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَ فَأَتۡبَعَهُمۡ فِرۡعَوۡنُ وَجُنُودُهُۥ بَغۡيٗا وَعَدۡوًاۖ حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَدۡرَكَهُ ٱلۡغَرَقُ قَالَ ءَامَنتُ أَنَّهُۥ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا ٱلَّذِيٓ ءَامَنَتۡ بِهِۦ بَنُوٓاْ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِينَ
phonetic: 10.90 Wa Jāwaznā Bibanī 'Isrā'īla Al-Baĥra Fa'atba`ahum Fir`awnu Wa Junūduhu Baghyāan Wa`adwan Ĥattá 'Idhā 'Adrakahu Al-Gharaqu Qāla 'Āmantu 'Annahu Lā 'Ilāha 'Illā Al-Ladhī 'Āmanat Bihi Banū 'Isrā'īla Wa 'Anā Mina Al-Muslimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them in tyranny and enmity until, when drowning overtook him, he said, "I believe that there is no deity except that in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am of the Muslims."
translations.english_hilali_khan: And We took the Children of Israel across the sea, and Fir‘aun (Pharaoh) with his hosts followed them in oppression and enmity, till when drowning overtook him, he said: "I believe that none has the right to be worshipped but He (Allâh) in Whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am one of the Muslims (those who submit to Allâh’s Will)."
translations.english_rwwad: We led the Children of Israel across the sea, then Pharaoh and his soldiers pursued them out of transgression and tyranny, until when he was drowning, he said, “I believe that none has the right to be worshiped except He in whom the Children of Israel believe, and I am one of those who submit to Allah.”

arabic_text: ءَآلۡـَٰٔنَ وَقَدۡ عَصَيۡتَ قَبۡلُ وَكُنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُفۡسِدِينَ
phonetic: 10.91 'Āl'āna Wa Qad `Aşayta Qablu Wa Kunta Mina Al-Mufsidīna

translations.english_saheeh: Now? And you had disobeyed [Him] before and were of the corrupters?
translations.english_hilali_khan: Now (you believe) while you refused to believe before and you were one of the Mufsidûn (evil-doers, the corrupters).
translations.english_rwwad: [He was told], “Now [you believe]? You had always been disobedient, and were one of the mischief-makers!

arabic_text: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ نُنَجِّيكَ بِبَدَنِكَ لِتَكُونَ لِمَنۡ خَلۡفَكَ ءَايَةٗۚ وَإِنَّ كَثِيرٗا مِّنَ ٱلنَّاسِ عَنۡ ءَايَٰتِنَا لَغَٰفِلُونَ
phonetic: 10.92 Fālyawma Nunajjīka Bibadanika Litakūna Liman Khalfaka 'Āyatan Wa 'Inna Kathīrāan Mina An-Nāsi `An 'Āyātinā Laghāfilūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [539]- i.e., his dead body will be preserved and not destroyed.

translations.english_saheeh: So today We will save you in body[539] that you may be to those who succeed you a sign. And indeed, many among the people, of Our signs, are heedless.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So this day We shall deliver your (dead) body (out from the sea) that you may be a sign to those who come after you! And verily, many among mankind are heedless of Our Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.).
translations.english_rwwad: So today We will preserve your body, so that you will be an example for those who come after you, yet most people are heedless of Our signs.”

arabic_text: وَلَقَدۡ بَوَّأۡنَا بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ مُبَوَّأَ صِدۡقٖ وَرَزَقۡنَٰهُم مِّنَ ٱلطَّيِّبَٰتِ فَمَا ٱخۡتَلَفُواْ حَتَّىٰ جَآءَهُمُ ٱلۡعِلۡمُۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقۡضِي بَيۡنَهُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ فِيمَا كَانُواْ فِيهِ يَخۡتَلِفُونَ
phonetic: 10.93 Wa Laqad Bawwa'nā Banī 'Isrā'īla Mubawwa'a Şidqin Wa Razaqnāhum Mina Aţ-Ţayyibāti Famā Akhtalafū Ĥattá Jā'ahumu Al-`Ilmu 'Inna Rabbaka Yaqđī Baynahum Yawma Al-Qiyāmati Fīmā Kānū Fīhi Yakhtalifūna

translations.english_saheeh: And We had certainly settled the Children of Israel in an agreeable settlement and provided them with good things. And they did not differ until [after] knowledge had come to them. Indeed, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And indeed We settled the Children of Israel in an honourable dwelling place (Shâm and Misr), and provided them with good things, and they differed not until the knowledge came to them. Verily, Allâh will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection in that in which they used to differ.
translations.english_rwwad: We settled the Children of Israel in a blessed land, and provided good things for their sustenance. They did not differ until after knowledge had come to them. Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that over which they used to differ.

arabic_text: فَإِن كُنتَ فِي شَكّٖ مِّمَّآ أَنزَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡكَ فَسۡـَٔلِ ٱلَّذِينَ يَقۡرَءُونَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ مِن قَبۡلِكَۚ لَقَدۡ جَآءَكَ ٱلۡحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكَ فَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمُمۡتَرِينَ
phonetic: 10.94 Fa'in Kunta Fī Shakkin Mimmā 'Anzalnā 'Ilayka Fās'ali Al-Ladhīna Yaqra'ūna Al-Kitāba Min Qablika Laqad Jā'aka Al-Ĥaqqu Min Rabbika Falā Takūnanna Mina Al-Mumtarīna

translations.english_saheeh: So if you are in doubt, [O Muḥammad], about that which We have revealed to you, then ask those who have been reading the Scripture before you. The truth has certainly come to you from your Lord, so never be among the doubters.
translations.english_hilali_khan: So if you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) are in doubt concerning that which We have revealed unto you, [i.e. that your name is written in the Taurât (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)], then ask those who are reading the Book [the Taurât (Torah) and the Injeel (Gospel)] before you. Verily, the truth has come to you from your Lord. So be not of those who doubt (it).[1]
translations.english_rwwad: If you are in doubt about what We have sent down to you [O Prophet], then ask those who read the Scripture before you. The truth has surely come to you from your Lord, so never be of those who doubt,

arabic_text: وَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِ ٱللَّهِ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡخَٰسِرِينَ
phonetic: 10.95 Wa Lā Takūnanna Mina Al-Ladhīna Kadhabū Bi'āyāti Allāhi Fatakūna Mina Al-Khāsirīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [540]- Among the interpretations of the last two verses is that they were meant to stir the Prophet (ﷺ) to declare and confirm his certainty, which he did.  Another is that although the words are addressed to the Prophet (ﷺ), they are directed to all people.

translations.english_saheeh: And never be of those who deny the signs of Allāh and [thus] be among the losers.[540]
translations.english_hilali_khan: And be not one of those who belie the Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) of Allâh, for then you shall be one of the losers.
translations.english_rwwad: and never be of those who reject the signs of Allah, for then you would be among the losers.

arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ حَقَّتۡ عَلَيۡهِمۡ كَلِمَتُ رَبِّكَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ
phonetic: 10.96 'Inna Al-Ladhīna Ĥaqqat `Alayhim Kalimatu Rabbika Lā Yu'uminūna

translations.english_saheeh: Indeed, those upon whom the word [i.e., decree] of your Lord has come into effect will not believe,
translations.english_hilali_khan: Truly! Those, against whom the Word (Wrath) of your Lord has been justified, will not believe.
translations.english_rwwad: Indeed, those upon whom the decree of Allah is passed will not believe,

arabic_text: وَلَوۡ جَآءَتۡهُمۡ كُلُّ ءَايَةٍ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
phonetic: 10.97 Wa Law Jā'at/hum Kullu 'Āyatin Ĥattá Yaraw Al-`Adhāba Al-'Alīma

translations.english_saheeh: Even if every sign should come to them, until they see the painful punishment.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Even if every sign should come to them, until they see the painful torment.
translations.english_rwwad: even if every sign were to come to them, until they see the painful punishment.

arabic_text: فَلَوۡلَا كَانَتۡ قَرۡيَةٌ ءَامَنَتۡ فَنَفَعَهَآ إِيمَٰنُهَآ إِلَّا قَوۡمَ يُونُسَ لَمَّآ ءَامَنُواْ كَشَفۡنَا عَنۡهُمۡ عَذَابَ ٱلۡخِزۡيِ فِي ٱلۡحَيَوٰةِ ٱلدُّنۡيَا وَمَتَّعۡنَٰهُمۡ إِلَىٰ حِينٖ
phonetic: 10.98 Falawlā Kānat Qaryatun 'Āmanat Fanafa`ahā 'Īmānuhā 'Illā Qawma Yūnis Lammā 'Āmanū Kashafnā `Anhum `Adhāba Al-Khizyi Fī Al-Ĥayāati Ad-Dunyā Wa Matta`nāhum 'Ilá Ĥīnin

translations.english_saheeh: Then has there not been a [single] city that believed so its faith benefited it except the people of Jonah? When they believed, We removed from them the punishment of disgrace in worldly life and gave them enjoyment [i.e., provision] for a time.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Was there any town (community) that believed (after seeing the punishment), and its Faith (at that moment) saved it (from the punishment)? (The answer is none) - except the people of Yûnus (Jonah); when they believed, We removed from them the torment of disgrace in the life of the (present) world, and permitted them to enjoy for a while.
translations.english_rwwad: There had never been any town that believed [after seeing the punishment] and benefited from its faith except the people of Jonah. When they believed, We removed from them the punishment of disgrace in the life of this world, and let them enjoy themselves for a while.

arabic_text: وَلَوۡ شَآءَ رَبُّكَ لَأٓمَنَ مَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كُلُّهُمۡ جَمِيعًاۚ أَفَأَنتَ تُكۡرِهُ ٱلنَّاسَ حَتَّىٰ يَكُونُواْ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 10.99 Wa Law Shā'a Rabbuka La'āmana Man Fī Al-'Arđi Kulluhum Jamī`āan 'Afa'anta Tukrihu An-Nāsa Ĥattá Yakūnū Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: And had your Lord willed, those on earth would have believed - all of them entirely. Then, [O Muḥammad], would you compel the people in order that they become believers?
translations.english_hilali_khan: And had your Lord willed, those on earth would have believed, all of them together. So, will you (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) then compel mankind, until they become believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Had your Lord willed, all those on earth would have believed altogether. Will you then compel people to become believers?

arabic_text: وَمَا كَانَ لِنَفۡسٍ أَن تُؤۡمِنَ إِلَّا بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِۚ وَيَجۡعَلُ ٱلرِّجۡسَ عَلَى ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَعۡقِلُونَ
phonetic: 10.100 Wa Mā Kāna Linafsin 'An Tu'umina 'Illā Bi'idhni Allāhi Wa Yaj`alu Ar-Rijsa `Alá Al-Ladhīna Lā Ya`qilūna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [541]- Among its meanings are filth, wrath, punishment, disbelief, confusion and error.

translations.english_saheeh: And it is not for a soul [i.e., anyone] to believe except by permission of Allāh, and He will place defilement[541] upon those who will not use reason.
translations.english_hilali_khan: It is not for any person to believe, except by the Leave of Allâh, and He will put the wrath on those who are heedless.
translations.english_rwwad: No soul can believe except by Allah’s will, and He will bring disgrace upon those who do not use their intellect.

arabic_text: قُلِ ٱنظُرُواْ مَاذَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَمَا تُغۡنِي ٱلۡأٓيَٰتُ وَٱلنُّذُرُ عَن قَوۡمٖ لَّا يُؤۡمِنُونَ
phonetic: 10.101 Qul Anžurū Mādhā Fī As-Samāwāti Wa Al-'Arđi Wa Mā Tughnī Al-'Āyātu Wa An-Nudhuru `An Qawmin Lā Yu'uminūna

translations.english_saheeh: Say, "Observe what is in the heavens and the earth." But of no avail will be signs or warners to a people who do not believe.
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say: "Behold all that is in the heavens and the earth," but neither Ayât (proofs, evidence, verses, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.) nor warners benefit those who believe not.
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “Look at what is in the heavens and earth.” But the signs and warnings are of no avail to those who do not believe.

arabic_text: فَهَلۡ يَنتَظِرُونَ إِلَّا مِثۡلَ أَيَّامِ ٱلَّذِينَ خَلَوۡاْ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡۚ قُلۡ فَٱنتَظِرُوٓاْ إِنِّي مَعَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡمُنتَظِرِينَ
phonetic: 10.102 Fahal Yantažirūna 'Illā Mithla 'Ayyāmi Al-Ladhīna Khalaw Min Qablihim Qul Fāntažirū 'Innī Ma`akum Mina Al-Muntažirīna

translations.english_saheeh: So do they wait except for like [what occurred in] the days of those who passed on before them? Say, "Then wait; indeed, I am with you among those who wait."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then do they wait for (anything) save for (a destruction) like that of the days of the men who passed away before them? Say: "Wait then, I am (too) with you among those who wait."
translations.english_rwwad: Are they waiting except for the same punishment that befell those who came before them? Say, “Then wait. I too am waiting with you.”

arabic_text: ثُمَّ نُنَجِّي رُسُلَنَا وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْۚ كَذَٰلِكَ حَقًّا عَلَيۡنَا نُنجِ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 10.103 Thumma Nunajjī Rusulanā Wa Al-Ladhīna 'Āmanū Kadhālika Ĥaqqāan `Alaynā Nunji Al-Mu'uminīna

footnotes.english_saheeh: [542]- From Allāh's punishment.

translations.english_saheeh: Then We will save Our messengers and those who have believed. Thus, it is an obligation upon Us that We save the believers.[542]
translations.english_hilali_khan: Then (in the end) We save Our Messengers and those who believe! Thus it is incumbent upon Us to save the believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Then We will save Our messengers and those who believe. For We took it upon Us to save the believers.

arabic_text: قُلۡ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِن كُنتُمۡ فِي شَكّٖ مِّن دِينِي فَلَآ أَعۡبُدُ ٱلَّذِينَ تَعۡبُدُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَلَٰكِنۡ أَعۡبُدُ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِي يَتَوَفَّىٰكُمۡۖ وَأُمِرۡتُ أَنۡ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
phonetic: 10.104 Qul Yā 'Ayyuhā An-Nāsu 'In Kuntum Fī Shakkin Min Dīnī Falā 'A`budu Al-Ladhīna Ta`budūna Min Dūni Allāhi Wa Lakin 'A`budu Allāha Al-Ladhī Yatawaffākum Wa 'Umirtu 'An 'Akūna Mina Al-Mu'uminīna

translations.english_saheeh: Say, [O Muḥammad], "O people, if you are in doubt as to my religion - then I do not worship those which you worship besides Allāh; but I worship Allāh, who causes your death. And I have been commanded to be of the believers
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم): "O you mankind! If you are in doubt as to my religion (Islâm), then (know that) I will never worship those whom you worship besides Allâh. But I worship Allâh Who causes you to die, and I am commanded to be one of the believers.
translations.english_rwwad: Say, [O Prophet], “O people, if you are in doubt about my religion, then I do not worship those whom you worship besides Allah. But I worship Allah, Who causes you to die, and I have been commanded to be one of the believers.

arabic_text: وَأَنۡ أَقِمۡ وَجۡهَكَ لِلدِّينِ حَنِيفٗا وَلَا تَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ
phonetic: 10.105 Wa 'An 'Aqim Wajhaka Lilddīni Ĥanīfāan Wa Lā Takūnanna Mina Al-Mushrikīna

translations.english_saheeh: And [commanded], 'Direct your face [i.e., self] toward the religion, inclining to truth, and never be of those who associate others with Allāh;
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And (it is revealed to me): Direct your face (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) entirely towards the religion Hanîf (Islâmic Monotheism, i.e. to worship none but Allâh Alone), and never be one of the Mushrikûn (those who ascribe partners to Allâh, polytheists, idolaters, disbelievers in the Oneness of Allâh, and those who worship others along with Allâh).
translations.english_rwwad: And be steadfast and exclusively devoted to true faith, and never be of those who associate partners with Allah.

arabic_text: وَلَا تَدۡعُ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ مَا لَا يَنفَعُكَ وَلَا يَضُرُّكَۖ فَإِن فَعَلۡتَ فَإِنَّكَ إِذٗا مِّنَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
phonetic: 10.106 Wa Lā Tad`u Min Dūni Allāhi Mā Lā Yanfa`uka Wa Lā Yađurruka Fa'in Fa`alta Fa'innaka 'Idhāan Mina Až-Žālimīna

footnotes.english_saheeh:
[543]- i.e., worship.
[544]- See footnote to 10:95.

translations.english_saheeh: And do not invoke[543] besides Allāh that which neither benefits you nor harms you, for if you did, then indeed you would be of the wrongdoers.'"[544]
translations.english_hilali_khan: "And invoke not besides Allâh, any such that will neither profit you nor harm you, but if (in case) you did so, you shall certainly be one of the Zâlimûn (polytheists and wrong-doers).[1]"
translations.english_rwwad: Do not supplicate besides Allah that can neither benefit nor harm you, for if you do so, you will be one of the wrongdoers.

arabic_text: وَإِن يَمۡسَسۡكَ ٱللَّهُ بِضُرّٖ فَلَا كَاشِفَ لَهُۥٓ إِلَّا هُوَۖ وَإِن يُرِدۡكَ بِخَيۡرٖ فَلَا رَآدَّ لِفَضۡلِهِۦۚ يُصِيبُ بِهِۦ مَن يَشَآءُ مِنۡ عِبَادِهِۦۚ وَهُوَ ٱلۡغَفُورُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
phonetic: 10.107 Wa 'In Yamsaska Allāhu Biđurrin Falā Kāshifa Lahu 'Illā Huwa Wa 'In Yuridka Bikhayrin Falā Rādda Lifađlihi Yuşību Bihi Man Yashā'u Min `Ibādihi Wa Huwa Al-Ghafūru Ar-Raĥīmu

translations.english_saheeh: And if Allāh should touch you with adversity, there is no remover of it except Him; and if He intends for you good, then there is no repeller of His bounty. He causes it to reach whom He wills of His servants. And He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And if Allâh touches you with harm, there is none who can remove it but He, and if He intends any good for you, there is none who can repel His Favour which He causes it to reach whomsoever of His slaves He wills. And He is the Oft-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.
translations.english_rwwad: If Allah afflicts you with harm, none can remove it except Him; if He wants good for you, none can withhold His bounty. He grants it to whom He wills of His slaves, and He is the All-Forgiving, the Most Merciful.”

arabic_text: قُلۡ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ قَدۡ جَآءَكُمُ ٱلۡحَقُّ مِن رَّبِّكُمۡۖ فَمَنِ ٱهۡتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهۡتَدِي لِنَفۡسِهِۦۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَإِنَّمَا يَضِلُّ عَلَيۡهَاۖ وَمَآ أَنَا۠ عَلَيۡكُم بِوَكِيلٖ
phonetic: 10.108 Qul Yā 'Ayyuhā An-Nāsu Qad Jā'akumu Al-Ĥaqqu Min Rabbikum Famani Ahtadá Fa'innamā Yahtadī Linafsihi Wa Man Đalla Fa'innamā Yađillu `Alayhā Wa Mā 'Anā `Alaykum Biwakīlin

translations.english_saheeh: Say, "O mankind, the truth has come to you from your Lord, so whoever is guided is only guided for [the benefit of] his soul, and whoever goes astray only goes astray [in violation] against it. And I am not over you a manager."
translations.english_hilali_khan: Say: "O you mankind! Now truth (i.e. the Qur’ân and Prophet Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم) has come to you from your Lord. So whosoever receives guidance, he does so for the good of his own self; and whosoever goes astray, he does so to his own loss; and I am not (set) over you as a Wakîl (disposer of affairs to oblige you for guidance)."
translations.english_rwwad: Say, “O people, the truth has come to you from your Lord. So whoever accepts guidance, it is only for his own good; and whoever goes astray, it is only for his own loss. I am not a keeper over you.”

arabic_text: وَٱتَّبِعۡ مَا يُوحَىٰٓ إِلَيۡكَ وَٱصۡبِرۡ حَتَّىٰ يَحۡكُمَ ٱللَّهُۚ وَهُوَ خَيۡرُ ٱلۡحَٰكِمِينَ
phonetic: 10.109 Wa Attabi` Mā Yūĥá 'Ilayka Wa Aşbir Ĥattá Yaĥkuma Allāhu Wa Huwa Khayru Al-Ĥākimīna

translations.english_saheeh: And follow what is revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], and be patient until Allāh will judge. And He is the best of judges.
translations.english_hilali_khan: And (O Muhammad صلى الله عليه وسلم), follow the revelation sent unto you, and be patient till Allâh gives judgement. And He is the Best of judges.
translations.english_rwwad: Follow what is revealed to you, and be patient until Allah passes His judgment, for He is the Best of Judges.
